intro: Cytisopsis dorycniifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces slender, hairy pods that contain several seeds. The species is adapted to arid conditions, with deep roots and a drought-resistant growth habit.
